alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 4:57PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lincoln County through 530 PM CST... At 456 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chandler, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and dime size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chandler, Stroud, Davenport, Sparks, Warwick and Kendrick. This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 159 and 182. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
